Class HTML_TreeNode

Description
Description | Descendents | Vars (details) | Methods (details)

HTML_TreeNode class

This class is supplementary to the above and provides a way to add nodes to the tree. A node can have other nodes added to it.

  • author: Harald Radi <harald.radi@nme.at>
  • author: Richard Heyes <richard@php.net>
  • access: public

Located in /HTML_TreeMenu-1.1.2/TreeMenu.php (line 113)

		Constructor HTML_TreeNode (line 197)
	
 
	
	

Constructor

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		HTML_TreeNode
		
			HTML_TreeNode
		
					([array $options = array()], [array $events = array()])
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				array
				$options: An array of options which you can pass to change                         the way this node looks/acts. This can consist of: 
    • text          The title of the node, defaults to blank
    • link          The link for the node, defaults to blank
    • icon          The icon for the node, defaults to blank
    • class         The CSS class for this node, defaults to blank
    • expanded      The default expanded status of this node, defaults to false
                                         This doesn't affect non dynamic presentation types
    • isDynamic     If this node is dynamic or not. Only affects
                                         certain presentation types.
    • ensureVisible If true this node will be made visible despite the expanded
                                         settings, and client side persistence. Will not affect
                                         some presentation styles, such as Listbox. Default is false
    			
    • 
					
  • 
				array
				$events: An array of javascript events and the corresponding event handlers.                        Additionally to the standard javascript events you can specify handlers                        for the 'onexpand', 'oncollapse' and 'ontoggle' events which will be fired                        whenever a node is collapsed and/or expanded.			
    •

Adds a new subnode to this node.

		setOption (line 231)
	
 
	
	

Allows setting of various parameters after the initial


constructor call. Possible options you can set are: 
  • text
  • link
  • icon
  • cssClass
  • expanded
  • isDynamic
  • ensureVisible
 ie The same options as in the constructor

	
    
				
  • access: public
    •

				string
				$option: Option to set

				string
				$value: Value to set the option to
